column4: - has a solution worth trying.    (jittery from going cold turkey on a Strike a Match addiction. - lol)
- msttcorefonts  includes the fonts themselves or just the tools to install them from another source (windows installation?)
- Ah okay, thank you. - patents, patents, patents, - bah who needs 'em. - lol
- yeah sure.. NOW you tell me.... - lol
actually, you've got a point, fonts themselves are hard/imposible to copyright - but you can still copyright the names and such...
he's got 1Gb of real RAM, he shouldn't need swap
6.06 is supposed to enable DMA automatically on all supported hardware - it did for me, when I did a re-install
- How old does your machine have to be to NOT support DMA?
pretty old, from what I've heard
try to install Mplayer. It's dependency hell. synaptic makes you jump through a bunch of hoops like that one. "Will not be installed"
- Is there any way to reclaim a forgotten password?

- The gnome taskbar crashed with a video resolution change in WINE.  All  of the icons moved to a small space on the right.  Including the "Applications" "Places" "System" . Can i edit a file to move them back?   Replacing them means their convenient labels disappear.
not sure - the standard three menus are in Add To Panel, though
- Okay. - Can i edit the gnome taskbar labels to say something like. "Great Apps" "My Empire" and "The inner Machinations"?  (Too Grandious? - NVM) - rofl
- I was joking. - seriously, Do you know where the gnome taskbar app. is located?
